channel.title: World : NPR
channel.description: NPR world news, international art and culture, world business and financial markets, world economy, and global trends in health, science and technology. Subscribe to the World Story of the Day podcast and RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2022 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: At least 8 people have died in an explosion at a Havana hotel
item.description: Dozens were injured in the blast that ripped away large sections of the outer wall at the Hotel Saratoga, a 19th century structure. A gas leak was the suspected cause of the explosion.
item.content:encoded:
Dozens were injured in the blast that ripped away large sections of the outer wall at the Hotel Saratoga, a 19th century structure. A gas leak was the suspected cause of the explosion.

(Image credit: Ramon Espinosa/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: A Russian oligarch's $325M superyacht has been seized in Fiji
item.description: U.S. authorities say the 348-foot vessel is owned by Suleiman Kerimov, a Russian oligarch previously sanctioned for alleged money laundering.
item.content:encoded:
U.S. authorities say the 348-foot vessel is owned by Suleiman Kerimov, a Russian oligarch previously sanctioned for alleged money laundering.

(Image credit: Leon Lord/Fiji Sun via AP, File)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 7 persistent claims about abortion, fact-checked
item.description: Several not-quite-right claims have continued to linger about abortion since the Supreme Court's 1973 Roe v. Wade decision.
item.content:encoded:
Several not-quite-right claims have continued to linger about abortion since the Supreme Court's 1973 Roe v. Wade decision.

(Image credit: Jim Watson/AFP via Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Jaclyn Diaz

item.title: Russians wreak havoc on Ukrainian farms, mining fields and stealing equipment
item.description: Ukraine is one of the world's biggest producers of wheat, corn and sunflower oil. Officials say 30% of farmland is now occupied or unsafe. "My fields were destroyed by the shelling," one farmer says.
item.content:encoded:
Ukraine is one of the world's biggest producers of wheat, corn and sunflower oil. Officials say 30% of farmland is now occupied or unsafe. "My fields were destroyed by the shelling," one farmer says.

(Image credit: Franco Ordoñez /National Public Radio)
item.dc:creator: Franco Ordoñez

item.title: Jill Biden heads to Romania and Slovakia to show support for NATO and Ukraine
item.description: Jill Biden's trip to the Slovakia-Ukraine border will be her most high-profile moment yet as first lady. On Mother's Day she meets with Ukrainian mothers and children who fled after Russia's invasion.
item.content:encoded:
Jill Biden's trip to the Slovakia-Ukraine border will be her most high-profile moment yet as first lady. On Mother's Day she meets with Ukrainian mothers and children who fled after Russia's invasion.

(Image credit: Carolyn Kaster/AP)
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: U.K. Conservatives lose London strongholds in blow to Boris Johnson
item.description: Voting for local councils across the country will be an important barometer for the next national elections.
item.content:encoded:
Voting for local councils across the country will be an important barometer for the next national elections.

(Image credit: Paul Marriott/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: Inside the Azovstal factory: Ukrainians 'only hope for a miracle'
item.description: The close-quarter battle inside the steel plant — the last Ukrainian stronghold of the strategic port city of Mariupol --appeared increasingly desperate.
item.content:encoded:
The close-quarter battle inside the steel plant — the last Ukrainian stronghold of the strategic port city of Mariupol --appeared increasingly desperate.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: 3 people were killed in a stabbing attack near Tel Aviv
item.description: Israeli authorities said a pair of Palestinian attackers went on a stabbing rampage in a town near Tel Aviv, killing at least three people and wounding four others before fleeing in a vehicle.
item.content:encoded:
Israeli authorities said a pair of Palestinian attackers went on a stabbing rampage in a town near Tel Aviv, killing at least three people and wounding four others before fleeing in a vehicle.

(Image credit: Maya Alleruzzo/AP)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press

item.title: The status of Iran nuclear deal talks
item.description: For weeks, talks between world powers and Iran over reviving the 2015 nuclear deal have been stalled — partly because of the war in Ukraine. But they're still a priority and could go either way.
item.content:encoded: For weeks, talks between world powers and Iran over reviving the 2015 nuclear deal have been stalled — partly because of the war in Ukraine. But they're still a priority and could go either way.
item.dc:creator: Peter Kenyon

item.title: What's a good word for the welcome given to Ukrainian refugees in Europe? 'Generous'
item.description: That's how Paul Spiegel characterizes the reception — and medical services — offered by European nations. He spent 7 weeks on the scene for the World Health Organization to assess the situation.
item.content:encoded:
That's how Paul Spiegel characterizes the reception — and medical services — offered by European nations. He spent 7 weeks on the scene for the World Health Organization to assess the situation.

(Image credit: Carsten Koall/Getty Images)
item.dc:creator: Diane Cole

item.title: First Lady Jill Biden head to Eastern Europe to visit Ukrainian refugees
item.description: First Lady Jill Biden is departing on a trip to Eastern Europe to visit Ukrainian refugees, as well as U.S. personnel in the region. It's her most high-profile endeavor since her husband took office.
item.content:encoded: First Lady Jill Biden is departing on a trip to Eastern Europe to visit Ukrainian refugees, as well as U.S. personnel in the region. It's her most high-profile endeavor since her husband took office.
item.dc:creator: Scott Detrow

item.title: Cinco de Mayo is part of a deeper story of 2 nations trying to define themselves
item.description: Cinco de Mayo has come to stand for a celebration of Mexican culture and heritage. On May 5, 1862, an epic battle was fought and won by Mexicans, which helped shape the future of Mexico and the U.S.
item.content:encoded: Cinco de Mayo has come to stand for a celebration of Mexican culture and heritage. On May 5, 1862, an epic battle was fought and won by Mexicans, which helped shape the future of Mexico and the U.S.
item.dc:creator: Ramtin Arablouei

item.title: Russia-Ukraine war: What happened today (May 5)
item.description: A roundup of key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.
item.content:encoded:
A roundup of key developments and the latest in-depth coverage of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

(Image credit: AP)
item.dc:creator: NPR Staff

item.title: Former U.S. consul in Rio de Janeiro raises new alarms about Brazil's Bolsonaro
item.description: The former U.S. consul in Rio de Janeiro, Scott Hamilton, speaks about his concerns about Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, and the implications for democratic institutions in the country.
item.content:encoded: The former U.S. consul in Rio de Janeiro, Scott Hamilton, speaks about his concerns about Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, and the implications for democratic institutions in the country.
item.dc:creator: Adrian Florido

item.title: Some Ukrainian refugees in Poland are now starting to return home
item.description: The war in Ukraine has forced millions of people to flee their homes. Some refugees in Poland however are now starting to return home.
item.content:encoded: The war in Ukraine has forced millions of people to flee their homes. Some refugees in Poland however are now starting to return home.
item.dc:creator: Jason Beaubien
